description.str: Horks up a glob of congealed light.
Splashes congealed light along the ground in a cone.
Puddle o' light.
Ripping off the hounds of Tindalos!
Fake gun that fires, uh.  Coordinate transform matrices?
Spawns LIXA reshuffle.
Ends the fight.

description: This is the opposite of a human silhouette; every facet of every detail on display, with no shape to make sense of them.  You can see both sides of an ID badge on a white labcoat.  You can see every muscle and nerve in eyes blown wide with horror.

death_function.message: The %s becomes part of the endless chamber.

description: The endless details of this figure are mercifully obscured by the viscous light coursing 'through' it.  It cannot contain anything, but the smears of light follow the shapes of stomach and intestines, and are splattered across what must be the lips and chin.

special_attacks.monster_message: The %s emits a torrent of congealed light!

special_attacks.description: The %s flings a gobbet of congealed light!

death_function.message: The %s becomes part of the endless chamber, and congealed light splashes away from the spot it occupied.

description: This distorted figure is a kaleidoscope of borders.  Every part of a human, flattened into place, warps wildly from second to second.  The word your mind conjures to describe it is 'rotating', though you're not sure why.

special_attacks.monster_message: The %s is in two places at once, and leaves something of itself behind.

death_function.message: The %s becomes part of the endless chamber.

description: This distorted figure is a kaleidoscope of borders.  Every part of a human, flattened into place, warps wildly from second to second.  The word your mind conjures to describe it is 'rotating', though you're not sure why.

special_attacks.monster_message: The %s is in two places at once, and leaves something of itself behind.

death_function.message: The %s becomes part of the endless chamber.

description: There is somehow more of this figure than the others.  Every side of every surface is on display, but each of those seems like the thin edge of a larger shape.  There is an eternity here, where a scientist used to be.

death_function.message: The %s becomes part of the endless chamber.

description: This is the entirety of the infinite chamber you are in, which perfectly contains itself.  If you look very closely, you might see yourself looking back.  You are sure that at any other time, seeing this would crack your brain like an eggshell.  But you understand it just fine right now.  And you can see it breathing.

special_attacks.description: The %s rapidly rearranges the coordinates of the infinite chamber.

special_attacks.monster_message: The %s rearranges the parts of itself you occupy, dilating them around you.

description.str: Placeholder for human corpses.  If you see this, it's a bug.
Placeholder for charred human corpses.  If you see this, it's a bug.
Placeholder for children corpses.  If you see this, it's a bug.

description: One of the vesper bats, a family of winged insect-eating mammals.  It roosts in caves and other hollows, and uses a form of echolocation to aerially navigate through tricky terrain at rapid speeds.
//: I ain't about to make a unique bat faction when I don't know any predators specialized in hunting bats but not birds. Batman's gotta make do.

description: A juvenile American black bear.  This one isn't much of a threat, but be wary of its parent; black bears are known for their protectiveness.

The American black bear.  A large omnivorous scavenger, it has powerful claws and jaws, and is an effective ambush hunter.  Most individuals are shy around humans, but they're fiercely protective of their cubs.
//: 220 days gestation period, the mother and cubs remain together for 16-17 months.

description: The North American beaver, the continent's largest rodent.  Its paddle-shaped tail helps ferry it through the water, and its prominent teeth can chew through wood, which it uses to build dam-like nests in lakes and streams.
//: 128 days gestation period + 14 days average to wean the young.

description: A small baby beaver.
//: 2 years to reach independence.

description: The black rat, an omnivorous rodent with sheer black fur and a long, rough tail.  Harbinger of pestilence, famine, and mange, it will sometimes swarm over the dead or dying.

The albino Norway rat, an omnivorous rodent with sleek white fur and a long, rough tail.  While its ancestors were harbingers of plague, these clever animals are omnipresent in modern biomedical research.  Due to its albino nature, its vision in both day and nighttime environments is very diminished.

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you!  It lets you pat its head and seems friendly.
petfood.pet: The %s lets out a happy squeak as you give its head a small scritch.

description: Originally not native in the U.S., this wild omnivore is a crossbreed between the Eurasian wild boar escaped from hunting reserves and the domesticated pig gone feral in the wilderness.  This one is just a baby, and is surprisingly cute.

Originally not native in the U.S., this wild omnivore is a crossbreed between the Eurasian wild boar escaped from hunting reserves and the domesticated pig gone feral in the wilderness.  Its population has skyrocketed during the last few decades.
A spotted wild cat living across much of North America.  It is not a serious threat to humans, but it can be aggressive when threatened.
A cuddly kitten meowing and scampering amidst the death.  Currently feral.
//: Kittens do not have their full fur yet and are really sensitive to cold temperature

description: In the absence of human stewardship, this small, domesticated predator has grown wary of humans.  Harried by the elements and the rigors of survival, it has become very skittish but is still motivated by food.
//: Their fur keeps them warm

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you!  Or maybe it just tolerates your presence better.  It's hard to tell with felines.
petfood.pet: The %s softly purrs as you pet it.  It demands more.

description: A small domesticated predator gone feral in the absence of human stewardship.  Located near the old Isherwood cabin.
This fluffy feline has longer hair than average.  Looks both beautiful and warm.  You want to bury your face in its soft fur and forget about the Cataclysm.
//: Longer fur, more cold protection

description: Barely more than a ball of fluff with eyes, this kitten looks like a longhair breed.
Impressively large for a domestic cat, this thick-haired breed was once native to the state of Maine.
This young Maine coon has tufted ears and a striking pattern on its face.
This cat has the distinctive dark extremities of a Siamese, first native to Asia but a common domestic breed in North America.
With cream-colored fur and dark points, you guess this kitten must be a young Siamese.
The short nose and rounded face of this cat suggest it comes from the popular Persian breed.  Its fur is already matted without anyone being able to groom it.
An adorably squashed nose and sad pleading eyes beg you to adopt this tiny Persian.
Looking like a spotted wild cat, the Bengal breed derives from the Asian leopard cat and Egyptian Mau.  Domesticated but very energetic.
You have seen spots like this on Bengal cats, but this one is just a kitten.
An unusual-looking cat with strikingly large eyes and ears, sporting a soft curly coat of fur.
This curly-coated kitten has enormous ears and inquisitive eyes, possibly a Devon Rex.
The Sphynx cat has practically no fur on its body, exposing its curiously wrinkled skin.
//: No fur, no cold protection

description: An almost total lack of fur on this kitten suggests it is of the hairless Sphynx breed.
Marked with the characteristic 'M' on its forehead and decorated with swirling stripes, the tabby's markings provide excellent camouflage.
Sharp lines around the eyes and familiar wavy stripes mark this kitten as a common tabby.
Partly white with patches of orange and black, the calico coloring tells you this cat is probably female.  The calico was the Maryland state cat, back when there were still states.
Splotches of tan and gray mark this young cat as a calico, and probably female.
Oh lawd, he comin'!  This impressive feline would once have been celebrated on internet cat forums for its chonkiness and majestic golden mane.  Appears surprisingly well-groomed despite its bulk.
//: Fat helps keeping their body warm

description: This poor little kitten is starving!  You wonder if you have some cat food aroundâ€¦
An adorable, little furry ball of darkness with pronounced green eyes.
A black ball of fur with prominent green eyes staring right into your soul.
The eastern chipmunk, a tiny omnivorous rodent with a characteristic striped coat.  It spends much of the day patrolling its elaborate burrow and the precious stores of foraged food within.

The Eastern cougar, a large feline predator.  Once thought extinct in this region, conservation efforts were successful in restoring a thriving population.  Fast and silent, this predator can cover long distances with powerful leaps and pounces, catching its prey with its deadly claws before delivering the finishing blow with its enormous fangs.
//: Cougars can breed all year, but mainly do so between January and August, they can have between 1 to 6 kittens at a time.

description: A cute and currently defenseless cougar kitten, meowing at its surroundings in search of its mother.  Be careful, these kittens grow quite big and ferocious in just a few months.
//: Kittens do not have their full fur yet and are really sensitive to cold temperature

description: The majestic tiger, a large feline predator.  Native to Asia, they are now most populous in private reserves in the United States.  Fast and powerful, this predator is one of the most recognizable and beloved animals in the world.  Also one of the deadliest.
The domestic cow, a baleful, ruminating farm animal.  This one is still a juvenile; it'll take a while before you can get any milk or a meaningful amount of meat from her.

death_drops.//: 25% chance of an item from group cow

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you!  It lets you pat its head and seems friendly.

description: The domestic cow, a baleful, ruminating farm animal.  She is quite muscular, and would be a great source of milk if domesticated or of meat and leather if slaughtered.

death_drops.//: 25% chance of an item from group cow

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you!  It lets you pat its head and seems friendly.

description: The Eastern coyote, also called the tweed wolf, is a territorial canine hybrid of wolves and true coyotes.  It can be intimidated by humans and other predators, but it will still fight when threatened, and the Cataclysm seems to have made it more fearless than before.
//: Average litter size of 4 pups, with gestation taking 63 days, but pupping occurs only from March to May

description: A cute coyote pup.  Despite the temptation, perhaps it is wise to refrain from petting it.
//: 9 months to reach adult size. 2 years to reach sexual maturity, but we don't necessarily model that.

description: A juvenile northern woodland white-tailed deer, a quick and strong grazing animal.  Favored prey of coyotes, wolves, and giant spider mutants.
The northern woodland white-tailed deer, a quick and strong grazing animal.  Favored prey of coyotes, wolves, and giant spider mutants.
//: 201 days gestation period. The fawn will stay with its mother for approximately one year, suckling for three to four months.

description: This once-average Labrador mixed-breed dog has clearly gone feral.  Though it likely still instinctively trusts humans, it's probably far from domestic by now.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you!  It lets you pat its head and seems friendly.
petfood.pet: The %s happily wags its tail while you pat its head.

description.str: This is an abstract for small dogs to copy from, so that they are less likely to mess up fields like zombification by accident.

//: NEVER use this abstract without overwriting the reproduction field, otherwise the monster copying from this will birth Labrador puppies

description: An adorable, defenseless Labrador puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.
The American bulldog is a hardy, well-built dog that seems suited for surviving the apocalypse.
//: 7 puppies and 300-320 days per-litter for size medium canines

description: An adorable, defenseless American bulldog puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

The oft-misunderstood pit bull is not actually a single breed but a label for several kinds of terriers.  It has average abilities, and is well-known for its 'lock jaw' - which isn't real, but its incredible determination is.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, defenseless pit bull puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.
An adorable beagle that has managed to survive the apocalypse.  Small and agile, but not especially tough.  Generally attacks in packs.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size tiny canines

description: An adorable, defenseless beagle puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.
An athletic and hyperactive dog that loves to herd animals and jump, the Border Collie is an agile attacker.  Although they can be easy to train, they don't work well in packs.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, defenseless Border Collie puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.
An ordinary breed full of affection, the boxer mastiff doesn't otherwise stand out among other dogs with its capabilities.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, defenseless boxer puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.
It's a tiny Chihuahua.  How it has managed to survive is a miracle, although its small size and aggressive nature may have proven useful.
//: 1-3 puppies & 240 days per-litter for size tiny canines

description: An adorable, defenseless Chihuahua puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.
A wiener dog!  This awkward looking dog can be a useful watchdog, plus it looks adorable as it bumbles around.  Needless to say, it doesn't make a good attack dog.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, defenseless dachshund puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.
The original K-9 breed.  An easily trained and powerful attack dog that will defend its owner to the death, however they don't work well in packs.
//: 1-7 puppies & 300-320 days per-litter for size medium canines

description: An adorable, defenseless German Shepherd puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

//: Rare, location specific only
description: A large and powerful breed, the Great Pyrenees has a beautiful, thick white coat.  Originally bred to deter wolves and other predators, now faced with protecting livestock from shambling hordes of undead.
//2: 1-7 puppies & 300-320 days per-litter for size medium canines

description: An adorable, defenseless Great Pyrenees puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

//: Rare, location specific only
description: A terrifying breed to face feral, Rottweilers are descended from Roman legion mastiffs.  It's robust, vicious, and quite capable of mauling a human to death.
//2: 1-7 puppies & 300-320 days per-litter for size medium canines

description: An adorable, defenseless Rottweiler puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.
An agile and sturdy breed that is welcome on any farm, the Australian cattle dog is adept at leaping fences and herding livestock.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, defenseless Australian cattle dog puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.
A large, white, fluffy herding dog from Siberia.  Samoyeds are rarely aggressive: Their smiley face doesn't help either.  They can be agile for their size and can be taught to pull sleds.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, defenseless Samoyed puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.

A large, black retriever with a luxurious, glossy coat and almond-shaped brown eyes that glitter with intelligence.  The Flat-coated Retriever has a temperament that can only be described as 'superb', having the energy to accompany humans who love physical activity, and the loyalty to lay around with those that do not.  Flat-coated Retriever will often do little more than bark at potential threats.
//: RIP Elwood Rufus Fluffy P. 9/21/15-3/21/25. Taken from us too soon

description: An adorable, defenseless Flat-coated Retriever puppy.  Much safer to tame than an adult dog.
A small, omnivorous canine with almost cat-like mannerisms.  It is a solitary hunter, and one of the only canids able to climb trees.
The red fox, an omnivorous canine and largest of the true foxes, it is a wily hunter with a combative, suspicious temperament.
Also known as the woodchuck, this ground squirrel has no actual talent for chucking wood.
A small grass-eater with a brown fur coat that changes to white in the wintertime.
A tiny and very cute snowshoe hare kit.
A hooved grazing mammal with a mane of hair, a sweeping tail, and powerful-looking muscles.  This one is still a juvenile; it'll take a while before it can be ridden.

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you!  It lets you pat its head and seems friendly.

description: A hooved grazing mammal with a mane of hair, a sweeping tail, and powerful-looking muscles.  A stalwart companion to humans for longer than recorded history, with some effort you should be able to get this one to trust you enough to ride it.

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you!  It lets you pat its head and seems friendly.

description: A hooved grazing mammal with a mane of hair, a sweeping tail, and powerful-looking muscles.  This one has been trained to have less of a fear reaction in order to assist with riot control and standard police work.  With some effort, you should be able to get this one to trust you enough to ride it.

The Northern bog lemming, a small, predominantly vegetarian rodent that spends its life in the murk of swamps and other wetlands.  Contrary to popular belief, these creatures are not particularly hapless or suicidal, but they can eat themselves into scarcity within a few generations.
The American mink, a partially aquatic weasel, once factory-farmed for its fur.  It is a capable fisher, but the presence of otters in these parts makes it rely more on food from the land.
The Eastern moose, the largest living species of deer.  While they aren't typically aggressive unless provoked, the autumn mating season can make the bulls quite ill-tempered.
The baby moose is called a calf.  They can outrun a human within days of birth and gain weight at an incredible pace.
//: 4-5 years to reach sexual maturity, so we're assuming 3.5 years to reach roughly the size of an adult.

description: A mutant variety of megafauna that evolved after the Cataclysm.  Easily recognized by the underslung tusks off each side of the mouth, in addition to an impressive rack of antlers.  Given the looks and how aggressive normal moose are, you reckon you shouldn't test the patience of this one.
//: Baby mutant moose are born quicker that their natural counterparts since they are mutants and that way they can be seen a little more often.

description: The baby moose is called a calf and so are its mutant descendants.  They can outrun a human within days of birth and gain weight at an incredible pace.
//: Baby mutant moose need to grow quicker to be able to survive in the world after the cataclysm.

description: A large omnivorous rodent with a thick furry pelt, found in wetlands across the Northern Hemisphere.  It marks its territory with a musky odor for which it is named.
The Virginia opossum, a small omnivorous marsupial native to North America.  About the size of a cat, it is hardy and adaptive, and a fairly common sight in urban areas.
The common striped skunk, similar in size to opossum or domestic cats, these mammals can often be smelled before they are seen.
//: Note on Aggression and triggers, keeping player_close as both anger and fear triggers gives me the desired result, I don't know if it causes issues somehow but it's the hacky way I found to get them to behave properly with spraying 'defensively'.

special_attacks.monster_message: A skunk raises its tail and squirts!

description: The North American river otter, a shy water-dwelling relative of the weasel that lives in large families along the banks of streams.  It is an excellent fisher and a resourceful survivor, using the abandoned dens of beavers and other animals to raise its own young.
A domesticated omnivore descended from the wild boar, intelligent and inquisitive.  Left to its own devices, it has gone feral.  Unlike the fully grown version, this juvenile can be tamed.

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you!  It lets you pat its head and seems friendly.

description: A domesticated omnivore descended from the wild boar, intelligent and inquisitive.  Left to its own devices, it has gone feral.
//: 116 days gestation, 3-5 weeks until the piglets get weaned, 10-30 days of maturation

description.str: rabbit abstract

description: A small mammal with a cute wiggling nose, a cotton ball tail, and a body made of delicious flesh.

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you!  It lets you pat its head and seems friendly.

description: A tiny bunny with a cute wiggling nose, a cotton ball tail, and a body made of delicious flesh.

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you!  It lets you pat its head and seems friendly.

description: A brown-coated cottontail rabbit, with a fluffy white tail.  Its small size and docile nature makes it easy prey for predators, at least the ones that can catch it.  You can't tell which one of the two cottontail species from the region this is.
A tiny and very cute cottontail rabbit kit.
A small mammal native to North America, distinctive for its dexterous paws and facial markings.  It is resourceful and agile enough to open sealed containers in search of food.

The brown rat is a worm-tailed rodent with long whiskers and beady eyes, larger than its cousin, the black rat.  Widespread mostly wherever humans are, they live off of foraging and will eat whatever they can find.
A timid, hooved grazing mammal, and one of the first animals ever domesticated.  Its body is covered in a thick layer of wool.
//: Puberty reached in 6-9 months.

description: A timid, hooved grazing mammal, and one of the first animals ever domesticated.  Its body is covered in a thick layer of wool, and the males have long, spiraling horns.
//: Sheep are seasonal breeders. The natural sexual season is positioned so that lambs will be born in the spring when the weather is warmer and grass is available.

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you!  It lets you pat its head and seems friendly.

description: A hooved browsing mammal known for climbing and eating just about anything.  The young are famously cute and cuddly.
//: Puberty reached in 6-9 months.

description: A hooved browsing mammal known for climbing and eating just about anything.  Either gender can have horns.
//: Timer copied from sheep

description: A small granivorous rodent with a long bushy tail, often seen darting amid the branches of trees.  A skittish varmint with an expression of unwavering austerity, it is the mortal enemy of cat and dog alike.
A tiny opportunistic rodent with a long bushy tail.  The pine squirrel is clever and cute, and hunted by nearly everything in the woods with a taste for meat.
The long-tailed weasel, a small but ubiquitous predator whose range extends across the continent.  It forms its den in small burrows, preferring to occupy the nesting holes of its prey.
A cunning pack predator, once extinct in the New England area, the wolf was successfully reintroduced and their numbers reached record highs in the decade before the Cataclysm.  Lucky you.
//: Wolves breed once a year, 4 to 6 puppies in one litter.

description: An adorable, defenseless wolf pup that will, in time, grow into a not-so-defenseless and debatably-adorable wolf.  Be careful of its parents, who are sure to be around nearby!

Also known as the caribou, this deer is native to North America and parts of Eurasia.  Although usually friendly, they can be aggressive during the autumn and winter mating season as well as when hungry.
A juvenile caribou, it is smaller than its adult counterparts, as well as having shorter antlers.
A baby llama.  Unlike their parents, the calves tend to be more friendly in demeanor.
//: Puberty reached in 6-9 months, copied from lamb but it probably applies the same on llamas.

description: A big and wooly herbivore domesticated by the Andean cultures of South America.  Llamas and their kin are distant relatives to camels and are adapted to mountain environments.
//: Llamas produce offspring between summer and fall according to internet sources, makes sense due to the southern hemisphere seasons.

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you!  It lets you pat its head and seems friendly.

description: Domesticated from the European polecat, this sleek and energetic mammal was commonly kept as a pet before the Cataclysm.

petfood.feed: The %s seems to like you!  It lets you pat its head and seems friendly.
petfood.pet: The %s lets out a happy squeak as you give its head a small scritch.

description: A young domesticated ferret, known as a kit.
//: Kits do not have their full fur yet and are really sensitive to cold temperature

description: Her eyes lie vacant and spittle foams in her mouth, as she recites from the hymns in rapturous ecstasy.
His eyes lie vacant and spittle foams in his mouth, as he recites from the hymns in rapturous ecstasy.

The Boeing-Daewoo RMES (Recon Mechanical Exoskeleton Suit), a recent acquisition by the U.S. military, it was designed to be used in a scout-recon-sniper role, due to its mobility, integrated laser sniper rifle, and suite of optics for target designation and battlefield awareness.  It was not deployed before the Cataclysm hit, though there were a few prototypes in the field.  You may be able to hack it to accept you as its pilot.  Like all mech-suits, it can act as a UPS from its large battery.

The Boeing-Daewoo CMES (Combat Mechanical Exoskeleton Suit), a recent acquisition by the U.S. military, it was designed to be used in a fire support role, due to its fearsome integrated Gatling laser.  It was not deployed before the Cataclysm hit, though there were a few prototypes in the field.  You may be able to hack it to accept you as its pilot.  Like all mech-suits, it can act as a UPS from its large battery.

The Boeing-Daewoo LMES (Lifting Mechanical Exoskeleton Suit), a recent acquisition by the U.S. military, it was designed to be piloted by an operator to load and unload heavy material, and for limited combat support roles.  It was not deployed before the Cataclysm hit, though there were a few prototypes in the field.  You may be able to hack it to accept you as its pilot.  Like all mech-suits, it can act as a UPS from its large battery.

An alien creature of uncertain origin.  Its shapeless pink body bears numerous sets of paired appendages of unknown function, and a pair of ribbed, membranous wings which seem to be quite useless.  Its odd, vaguely pyramid-shaped head bristles with numerous wavering antennae, and it moves with an uncanny fluidity on its many legs.

An alien creature of uncertain origin.  Its shapeless pink body bears numerous sets of paired appendages of unknown function, and a pair of ribbed, membranous wings which seem to be quite useless.  Its odd, vaguely pyramid-shaped head bristles with numerous wavering antennae, and it moves with an uncanny fluidity on its many legs.  It is carrying an oblong object that hums with an odd keening sound.

special_attacks.monster_message: The mi-go's numerous antennae sync their movements for a brief moment.

description: This mi-go has a slender body with snaking carapace along it, and even more paired clawed appendages.  Its claws are smaller and more delicate looking, but that does not make them less unnerving.

A more heavily armored version of the common mi-go.  Its trunk is a shapeless mass of strange flesh encased in an iridescent carapace, from which sprout several appendages terminating in what appear to be devices of some sort.  Its pyramidal head is encrusted in barnacle-like armor, aside from the bristling antennae that serve as its - you assume - sensory devices and mouth.

special_attacks.monster_message: The mi-go's numerous antennae sync their movements for a brief moment.

description: This creature resembles the smaller mi-go like a grizzly bear resembles a human.  Its enormous, thick body is covered in an iridescent segmented carapace, like a scarab crossed with an isopod.  It boasts several pairs of deadly looking claws and other appendages, and it moves with a strange, slow grace, like an otherworldly dancer.  It appears to be carrying weaponry.

special_attacks.monster_message: The mi-go's numerous antennae sync their movements for a brief moment.

description: This creature resembles the smaller mi-go like a grizzly bear resembles a human.  Its enormous, thick body is covered in an iridescent segmented carapace, like a scarab crossed with an isopod.  It has been mostly pulled apart and is stuck to a surgical table that seems to be keeping it alive.

This slender mi-go is a little smaller than most others of its kind.  It has a weird, oblong thing attached to the center of its body with some sort of a diaphragm or a membrane on the end.  The thing seems like an integral part of the mi-go's body, and all its appendages are supporting it to prevent swaying.

special_attacks.description: The mi-go scout fires its weapon!

description: This monster exists only for testing purposes.
This monster exists only for grab testing purposes.  Same grab strength as a basic zombie.
//: Basic zombie strength

description: This monster exists only for grab testing purposes.  Same grab strength as a Tier 2 grabbing zombie.
This monster exists only for grab testing purposes.  Same grab strength as a Tier 3 grabbing zombie.
This grab testing monster has a strange fascination with your left arm.
This grab testing monster has a strange fascination with your right arm.
This 100kg monster exists only to test ranged pulls using the base 0.5 pull weight ratio.
This 100kg monster is strong enough to pull 250kg targets.
This monster exists only to fail pulling its target despite technically being able to.  Truly a cursed existence.
This monster exists to drag you behind it briefly.
This monster exists only for weakpoint testing purposes.
A towering, hulking dragon, with tremendous, curving horns and shining red scales, its glowing maw peeled back in a hateful grimace as its eyes bore into yours.
//: Zombie faction so they don't attack a clear prop
//2: ahh! it sees you!

description: Your precious generator, noisily humming away.  Defend it at all costs!
Mom?
The multi-cooker's got a mind of its own!  Look out!
Is this mannequin moving?
An image made from light, nearly identical to the real deal.
A giant inflatable dragon for Halloween decorations.
A human-sized inflatable ghost for Halloween decorations.
A human-sized mannequin, speaking pre-recorded phrases.
A tiny and shelled aquatic gastropod of either native or introduced stock.  Dangerous to eat raw but properly cooked and cleaned it may serve as a fine dish.
//: this creature should be harvestable using crap pots or fish traps but requires extra work to convert from monster to item

description: A shelled gastropod either of native or introduced stock.  This one looks larger than usual.
A snail grown to human size.  Its mouth and underside dripping acid.
A small snail larva.
An enormous gastropod with a massive shell on its back.  It slowly crawls over the ground while leaving acid in its path.
A gastropod either of native or introduced stock.  This one looks larger than usual.
A disturbingly large mutated slug as large as a human.  Venom drips from what must be its mouth, and it is covered with sticky mucus.
A small slug larva.
A mutated leopard slug, as wide as a golf cart.  Venom dripping from its fanged maw as it slithers around slowly, leaving a trail of glistening slime.

A sluglike creature, eight feet long and the width of a refrigerator.  Its black body glistens as it oozes its way along the ground.  Eyestalks occasionally push their way out of the oily mass and look around.

//: It can see you (and will run/follow)

Warning: Do not use without death_guilt function. This helps count the amount of animals (e.g hatchlings, kittens) before player goes numb.
Boss, you killed a child! Warning: Do not use without a death_guilt function. This helps count the children kills before player goes numb.
Warning: Do not use without death_guilt function. This helps count the non-npc human (e.g civilian/futile fighter) kills before player goes numb.
Warning: Do not use without death_guilt function. This helps count the all the other kills that do not fit the other three (e.g blood sacrifice) before player goes numb.
Immune to Chiropteran saliva. Use for any creature with nonstandard blood (ie mi-go, insects, but probably not zombies or fungalized animals, unless they have acid blood or something).
Immune to telepathic damage/detection
This monster has significant armor, and it is much harder to pulp it without a proper tool
//2: Rule of thumb: if monster has something like a spine character wants to break, and it is covered by any armor, use this flag

description: A deformed mutant in a torn jumpsuit, looking at you with insane hatred.  Their skin is a chaotic mix of scales, fur and chitin, and their fingers end in long talons.

A towering mutated test subject, covered in thick fur and the torn bottom part of a jumpsuit.  Their legs end in large padded feet not unlike a dog's, but they still manage to stand upright, freeing up their clawed hands to tear you apart.

A gigantic mutated test subject, still wearing the tattered remains of an orange jumpsuit.  They walk on four warped legs ending in hooves, and their head is dominated by a glistening, tangled crown of antlers that scratch the ceiling.

A horribly mutated experimental subject.  Their original body - still wearing an orange jumpsuit - flops around lifelessly, carried by twelve segmented legs covered in hairy chitin erupting from their back.  At the base of the front pair of legs, an almost-human scalp gives way to a dozen irregularly-sized eyes and a set of mandibles, and from their hind end a stinger not unlike a scorpion's emerges.

A mutated test subject, running on all fours at alarming speed.  Their short fur changes color to match the background in an instant, making you struggle to keep the thing in focus.  Their thin limbs end in long talons, and their mouth is held perpetually open by a set of knife-sized fangs.

An experimental subject wearing a surprisingly clean orange jumpsuit.  They look unchanged at a distance, but as you approach their head spins towards you with unnatural speed.  Their face is disconcertingly beautiful, but their eyes shine with an intelligence far beyond human - and a deep disgust directed at you.

special_attacks.monster_message: The mutant gestures at you and barks a few orders, sending its pack of mutants into a frenzy.

description: A thin child with a shaved head, wearing a too-large white lab coat over a baggy orange jumpsuit.  They turn their head towards you with uncanny speed, and you're taken aback by the inhuman curiosity burning in their eyes.  Their angelic smile does very little to reassure you of their intentions.

death_function.message: The child's eyes widen, and they try to say something before falling to the ground.

description: An enormous mutant hidden beneath a gray segmented shell, crawling on a carpet of innumerable tentacles covered with suckers.  They hold three thicker, branching limbs high on their front end, each dotted with dozens of unblinking eyeballs.
Sometime between the Cataclysm and now, this black bear has gained two extra heads.  This doesn't seem to have improved its disposition.
This mutated beaver is almost double its normal size, and its back is covered with tough-looking bristles.
An unnaturally large baby beaver with an array of bristles covering its back.
This mutant beaver's body is covered with brightly-colored feathers in a particularly eyecatching pattern.  It must have been very lucky not to have been caught by a predator before now.
This beaver kit lacks any fur covering its body, instead looking reminiscent of a plucked chicken.
Were it not for the misshapen snout and visible teeth, this would look like an ordinary Northeastern coyote.  Closer inspection of its mouth reveals row after row of serrated, shark-like teeth.
A cute coyote pup.  Though, on a closer look, something is off about it.
Unnatural bulges line the neck of this obviously-mutated coyote; green-tinted foam flecks from its lips, and there's a crazed look in its eyes.
A cute coyote pup.  Though, on a closer look, something is off about it.
This once-ordinary deer has grown a disturbingly agile array of extra limbs, plus three extra eyes.  Its antlers wriggle subtly in the wind.
//: 201 days gestation period. The fawn will stay with its mother for approximately one year, suckling for three to four months.

description: This obviously mutated adolescent deer moves unsteadily on its eight legs, nervously scanning the area with all five eyes.
This dog of unidentifiable breed looks like it has seen better days.  Its wiry hair is patchy, revealing scales underneath, but it still happily wags its tails anyways.

This dog has undergone visible mutation.  While its body is larger than normal, its legs are noticeably elongated, muscular and covered in long cord-like fur.  It easily stands as tall as you and watches your every move closely with reflective eyes.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, but unusual puppy.  It wags its tail happily but something about its legs seems off.

This stocky dog has undergone visible mutation.  Its jaw has widened and features more teeth than any dog should ever have.  While its toothy grin is unnerving, its tail wags as energetically as ever.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, but unusual puppy.  It wags its tail happily but something about its mouth seems off.
This dog has undergone visible mutation.  Its paws are larger than normal and have developed long digging nails.  Its fur is extremely short, barely covering its leathery skin.
//: 1-4 puppies & 270 days per-litter for size small canines

description: An adorable, but unusual puppy.  It wags its tail happily but something about its paws seems off.
Its paws have grown to be longer, and it seems capable of briefly standing on its hindlimbs.  You wonder if this sleazy beast is able to open doors yet.
An eight-foot-tall, ghastly white penguin.  Its muscular body suggests immense strength, but it seems placid unless otherwise provoked.
A hellish, vaguely humanoid horror, two stories tall.  Its face is grotesquely stretched out, its limbs deformed to unrecognizable outgrowths.

This is some form of unnatural changeling creature; its appearance is a bland mockery of the human form.  Featureless and pale, its repugnant countenance is all the more unsettling due to its lack of eyes and distinguishing features except for a perfectly round mouth.  Adding to its unearthly appearance is the way it moves, stiff and doll-like as though it was only feigning knowing how to walk.
A defiled human body, once living.  Tortured to death long ago, it remains chained to the altar, the putrescent flays of its peeled skin quivering like so much flotsam upon a murky pond.

This is some sort of unearthly pink flesh sac; moist and ridged with veins, it is otherwise without discernible exterior features.  Seemingly immobile and defenseless, it sits in place, swelling and collapsing upon itself as it breathes.
A weird mass of immobile, breathing pink goo.  The other breathers seem to originate from this one.
Uncountable jagged spikes, cleaving reality as they fly through its invisible seams.
Misshapen spikes of concrete and rebar crumble upwards from the floor, held aloft by strands of visual distortion.  Sound around it is drowned and distorted into an incessant drone.

death_function.message: The distortion fades as the %s crumbles.

special_attacks.monster_message: Scraps of metal fly off the spur and into the nearby swarms!

description: Articulated limbs slip into the outlines of shadow, each a conduit for the kaleidoscopic maw from which they emerge.
An explosion of glistening fangs, itself but a small reflection of the greater horror.

death_function.message: The %s shatters like pane of glass.

description: A limb of shadow, itself but a small reflection of a greater horror.

death_function.message: The %s shatters like pane of glass.

description: The distressed movements of the juvenile reveal conjoined layers of flailing legs and fangs.  It is no spider as you know it.

death_function.message: The %s shatters like pane of glass.

description: Layers of flailing limbs struggle against an impaled emerald lance.
A gigantic shadow, chaotically changing in shape and volume.  Two piercing orbs of light dominate what can only be described as its head.
A crazed individual, the bloody scars on the side of its shaved head suggest some sort of partial lobotomy.
A domesticated mongrel of the canine persuasion.  In the absence of human society, it has turned feral.

An enormous disembodied eyeball the size of a person, flying through the air through some unknown agency.  Wreathed in unnatural flickering blue flame, it possesses a blazing yellow iris with a slitted pupil like that of a cat, and trails a set of flailing black tendrils as it slowly drifts about.  You involuntarily get a heavy, sinking feeling deep in your gut as you watch its gaze comb over the world around it.
//: Add a demihuman alien anatomy for things like flaming eye's and Mi-go, polyps and other lovecraftian horrors from other dimensions

description: A half-polypous, utterly alien creature.  It's only partly material and has the ability to fly, despite the absence of wings.  It produces strange whistling noises which dominate every other sound.

//: Star vampires are split into two: The fanged version draws blood very, very quickly, while the coiling version isn't as fast, but its hards are quite hard to escape from.
//2: These variations are concealed from the player, with the differences only being visible via examining the vampire and reading the description. This removes visible, awkward gamification, while still keeping the intent of the split. (less walking corpse pyrrhic victories)
description: Originally invisible, you can now see the myriad thin tentacles tipped with gnashing maws that make up this creature.  The small central body is dominated by an enormous fanged mouth from which emerges a near-constant high-pitched tittering.

special_attacks.//: Bite for targets whose blood the star vampire does not want or cannot drink.  Should never target the player unless they can't bleed or have unappetizing blood.

special_attacks.miss_msg_u: %1$s tries to clutch onto you, but you dodge!
special_attacks.miss_msg_npc: %1$s tries to clutch onto you <npcname>, but they dodge!
special_attacks.no_dmg_msg_u: %1$s tries to clutch onto your %2$s, but can't penetrate your armor.
special_attacks.no_dmg_msg_npc: %1$s tries to clutch onto <npcname>'s %2$s, but can't penetrate their armor.

description: There was nothing here a moment ago, but now you see the faintest outline of an otherworldly creature approaching you with jittery leaps.  Trying to focus on it reveals a pointed beak dripping translucent fluid and rows upon rows of bladed legs grasping the floor, before your eyes begin to burn and your head starts to spin.
//grab: Great at pulling, bad at holding - maybe it's playing with you

description: This is some sort of unnatural cross between a bull and a man.  Quite different from the minotaur of legend, it possesses a shaggy white bull's head on an otherwise unremarkable human body.  Clad in sagging socks and stained jockey shorts, it grunts and snuffles, drooling ropey strands of white slobber down its chest.  You occasionally catch a glint in its eyes and freeze up involuntarily, like a deer in headlights.

This is some form of eldritch monstrosity; an uncouth black being with smooth, oily skin and unpleasant horns that curve inward toward each other.  Tall and thin, the shadows cling unnaturally to its vaguely defined humanoid form as it shuffles along, its hands twitching and spasming so rapidly as to appear a little more than a black blur of claws.  Despite the night-terror esque appearance, it doesn't appear aggressive.
A dog's body with a mass of ropey, black tentacles reaching out from its head.

Isometry is torn from the fine structure of space, and the emptiness between disgorges its terrible brood upon the world.  Its form is both incomprehensibly vast and infinitely narrow, with splayed limbs that could fold into the paper-thinness of edges.

A grotesque dog-like beast, its frame is angular and emaciated and its head is like that of an abyssal fish.  When it moves, its twisted limbs duplicate, merge, disappear, and reform in dissonance, as if a hundred copies of itself were somehow forced to inhabit the same space.  Extraneous to our reality, it moves between the corners of the world, hunting those that would dare step beyond time and space.

A grotesque dog-like beast, its frame is angular and emaciated and its head is like that of an abyssal fish.  When it moves, its twisted limbs duplicate, merge, disappear, and reform in dissonance, as if a hundred copies of itself were somehow forced to inhabit the same space.  Extraneous to our reality, it moves between the corners of the world, hunting those that would dare step beyond time and space.
An enormous fleshy snail, with an oddly human face.  Eyestalks protrude from where the eyes should be.

This is some sort of great viperine creature, possessed of a curiously distorted head and massive clawed appendages.  It partially supports itself with the aid of black, rubbery wings of monstrous dimensions.  The wings beat slowly like an eagle while the body coils through the air like how an eel swims in water.

This is some form of otherworldly hound.  Lean and hungry-looking, its twisted red flesh is stretched tightly across its misshapen, angular frame.  Loping grotesquely along, its unusually long neck stretches forward, its skull-like head near the ground as it sniffs out its prey.  Its foulness partially veiled by some arcane force, it seems to almost flicker in and out of your perceptions as if you were looking at it from the corner of your vision.
//: a good candidate for an alien anatomy harvest

description: An animate shadow.  Looking like nothing more than an errant patch of normal shadow, it draws your attention by the way it moves subtly and whispers softly in the back of your mind.  Strange intrusive thoughts accompany the quiet murmur, trying to forcefully supplant your own.
An animate shadow in the form of a long and sinuous snake.  Translucent and dark, it glides silently across the floor, wriggling and flexing as it moves.

A gargantuan protoplasmic blob, constantly reshaping, forming new pseudopods seemingly at will.  All over its body are eyes that form and disappear.  The rapid and chaotic way it reconstitutes itself gives the impression of it boiling over with some kind of primordial fury.
An amorphous black creature, detaching and sprouting tentacles without any apparent pause.
A human body, but with its limbs, neck, and hair impossibly twisted.  It clambers around swiftly, making awful screeching sounds.

A huge, slimy worm-like creature.  Its pale, flattened head drips an oily mucus as it breaches the ground, searching for prey.  Its pinkish mouth opens and closes, revealing long fangs glistening with ropey strands of saliva, which leave smoldering stains wherever they drip.

special_attacks.description: The yugg launches a viscous barb!

description: A twisting spot in the air, with some kind of morphing mass at its center.

An animate blotch of conflicting symmetries, erratically hovering through the air.  It's not even real enough to hold a stable shape, and its entire form is constantly in flux.  You can see through it - not as if it were transparent, but as if it isn't quite fully here.

special_attacks.monster_message: The shifting mass passes through you as if you were an illusion, and a slight wave of fatigue washes over you.

description: A twisted shape floating in midair; its angles don't seem to quite add up - it hurts to look at.  Is it inanimate?  Alive?  Something else?  You can't make heads or tails of it at all, but you can see through it - not as if it were transparent, but as if it isn't quite fully here.

special_attacks.monster_message: You get a very clear view of the impossible shape.

description: Every sense you have claims this space to be empty, but your mind is not fooled.  There is an emptiness here that is far from natural or safe.

special_attacks.monster_message: The absence intensifies.

death_function.message: The %s returns to normal levels of empty.

description: A gigantic, probing appendage blindly feeling the area around it.  All of your senses scream at you that it's the size of a truck, and yet it only takes up about as much space in the world as you do.  It seems to be jutting through a portal, suggesting that it's merely a smaller extension of something much larger.

death_function.message: The %s is pulled back through the closing portal.

description: An oblong figure floating parallel with the ground, some feet in the air like a piece of paper - Its far thinner than one as well, to the point it would be invisible if looked at with the right angle.

special_attacks.monster_message: Standing close to the %s, your body is violently dragged down to the second dimension.  You're there for only an instant but the experience is enough to send you reeling.

death_function.message: Your memory can't decide whether the %s was even there in the first place.

description: The silhouette of a human body, reaching towards you like it needs help.  It has no eyes, but you can still feel it staring through you.

death_function.message: The %s begins to cry as it disappears.

description: Your mind can't decide if this is a vast structure, or an endless swarm of tiny flying sharp things.  The only thing you know for sure is that it is far too large to fit in the space it occupies.

special_attacks.monster_message: The integrity of spacetime is violated.

death_function.message: Your memory can't decide whether the %s was even there in the first place.

description: You are uncertain whether this dwarfs you or you dwarf it.  Its exact shape and number of dimensions is constantly changing, but it is always sharp enough to cut a moment in half.

special_attacks.monster_message: You are cut in ways worse than physical.

death_function.message: Your memory can't decide whether the %s was even there in the first place.

description: This formless, pitch-black mass wriggles on the ground as it reshapes itself before your eyes.  It slowly drags itself towards you with many tendrils of varied sizes.  As it gets closer to you, its wriggling intensifies as if it reacted to you.
//: No NETHER or it will run away at low HP

special_attacks.monster_message: The chunk twists and tears itself as it reacts to your presence!

death_function.message: The material stabilizes and reforms itself into a small chunk of unknown composition.

description: This formless, pitch-black mass wriggles and pulses on the ground as it reshapes itself before your eyes.  It slowly drags itself towards you with many tendrils of varied sizes.  As it gets closer to you, its pulsing intensifies as if it reacted to you.

This formless, pitch-black mass wriggles violently and noisily on the ground as it reshapes itself before your eyes.  It slowly drags itself towards you with many tendrils of varied sizes sparkling with electricity.  As it gets closer to you, its wriggling intensifies and its sparks grow brighter as if it reacted to you.
This looks nothing like you.  It's barely real.  So why does your mind keep mistaking it for you?

death_function.message: The %s vanishes but you can still feel it.

special_attacks.monster_message: You can feel the %s.

description: This looks almost nothing like you.  Its form isn't even stable.  So why does your mind keep mistaking it for you?
This only looks a little like you.  It's obviously not you.  So why does your mind keep mistaking it for you?
This doesn't look like you.  It looks like what you've dreamed you could be.  Why does your mind keep mistaking you for a bad copy of it?

A figure in a high-tech suit, their outline contorted as though you were viewing them through a prism.  Their movements are strained but determined, pushing through apparent pain with feverish resolve, dead-set on reaching their target.

special_attacks.monster_message: The creature screams "SOMEONE HELP ME, ANYONE!".

description: A figure in combat gear, distorted and shattered like broken glass.  They thrash around as they move, an expression of shock and anguish frozen on their face.

death_function.message: The soldier fades away to nothing.

description: Your shadow is host to something alien.

death_function.message: Your shadow seemingly becomes normal again.

description: A common human.  It looks exactly like a human looks.  You can see them.  They can see you.  You know they know you can see them.  They know you know you can see them.  They move towards you.
//: it must be spooky, but god im bad in this stuff

special_attacks.monster_message: You feel something was destroyed inside you.

description: An animate blotch of conflicting shapes, when you look at or think of this, memories of your wrongdoings rise to the surface.

special_attacks.monster_message: The guilt makes no physical movement and yet you feel the force of its assault.  Everything feels heavier.

description: An animate blotch of conflicting shapes, when you look at or think of this, a desire to stop moving rises.

special_attacks.monster_message: The sloth does nothing, and you feel time itself aiding your desire to do nothing.

description: What looks to be a loose mass of worm-like appendages reveals a solid body beneath, a great maw of rows of serrated fangs taking up most of the body.  It is either very lethargic or stalking prey, sitting in place without much obvious motion.
A wriggling brown grub of unnatural origin, slithering along the ground and unnaturally pulsating.  As it moves along, it chews through any available flesh with surprising speed.
A strange quadrupedal creature with long, lanky limbs and a gaping maw.  A long sharp spike protrudes from it's back, which occasionally launches from its' joint to stab prey before slinking back in.
A very wet, snake-like creature which you estimate to be five feet long, covered in slime and slithering about.  Occasionally, it will attach itself to the flesh around it and begins to suck.

Tall, partially armored, barely humanoid creature with a long appendage growing out of its side.  Flexible spearlike rods protrude throughout its body, seemingly holstered under the skin.  It feverishly darts and scouts the surroundings, looking to rip its victims apart.

special_attacks.description: huntsman's appendage hurls a sharp outgrowth out of its body!

description: A small fish symbiote that resembles a deformed, eyeless piranha.  It swims blindly in the yellow ichor, wriggling incessantly with malicious intent.

There is barely anything there, but you do notice hints of a faint, translucent veiled creature that you can only describe as butterfly-like.  While strangely alluring, it seems unsuited to the atmosphere and is slowly falling apart.
A small chunk of curious looking roots, constantly trying to grow and expand but failing miserably.  It has grown weak, as if incompatible with the very soil it is in.

Mostly covered in wet-looking, long strands that remind you firmly of hair, this abomination has a single but very pronounced leg.  It keeps its balance with its odd hair on the rear.  Yet it seems to shrivel and die with each gust of wind it is hit with.
This small, three legged bug-like creature curiously wriggles its 5 antennae.  Its body somewhat reminds you of a stink bug.  It looks like a fish out of water and is getting weaker by the minute.
A writhing mass of strange flesh and something that oddly resembles tentacles.  It is getting more pale by the minute.
As it moves, this cat's colors shift unnaturally in the light.  You can't make out the breed, but its fur pattern seems to change with every step.
//: Higher dodge due to the constantly changing fur pattern

description: It is universally known that cats are liquid, but this cat's body is actually quivering while it walks around.  It also enjoys resting while twisting its body in ways that would break a normal cat's bones.

death_function.message: The %s's body splashes one last time.

description: Seeing how unnaturally dark this black cat's fur is, you are certain this is no ordinary cat.  Its fur seems to absorb light from the surroundings.

This dog doesn't cast a shadow, and if you squint hard enough you can see right through it.  Its condition doesn't appear to do any harm to it, though it seems to cause trouble when it tries to groom itself.
A rather average looking dog until you notice the third eye, right on its forehead, covered by a thick eyelid.  Whenever its open, small particles of dust from the ground rise and swirl around it.

You are completely unable to recall anything about what this dog looks like.  You know it's a dog, you know it's there, you know you can see it, but any further information about it isn't retained in your mind.
A resplendent alien fern, crowned with flowers colored deep indigo.  It appears to be the centerpiece of this otherworldly bloom.

special_attacks.description: Lightning arcs from the leech blossom!

description: A resplendent and voluminous alien fern.  A faint buzzing sound emanates from it, and the shadow cast by its canopy continuously glows with electric charge.

special_attacks.description: Lightning arcs from the leech stalk!

description: A trunk reaches tall into the sky, its topmost branches glowing with yellow light.  A low drum periodically shakes its vicinities.
The translucent egg pods of an alien plant, firmly attached by luminous rhizomes.  You can barely distinguish a root drone floating within a cloudy substance.

special_attacks.description: Lightning arcs from the pod cluster!

description: This clump of woody vegetation hastily clambers around in a lizard-like fashion.  Three translucent scale-leaves stand tall on the backside of the creature, and the thin ridges within them periodically glow through some unknown means.  It's seemingly a symbiote of the nearby alien ferns, and looks ready to defend them with its life.

special_attacks.description: Sparks fly from the root runner!

description: A small bulb with a beak-like protuberance, skittishly roaming about under three tendril rhizomes.  Dripping and glistening, it resembles a newborn animal rather than a sapling grown from seeds.

special_attacks.description: Lightning arcs from the root pod!

description.str: This is an abstract monster for other snakes to copy from, so that we have some common foundation to work with.  If it appears in the game that's a bug.
This is an abstract monster for other snakelets to copy from, so that we have some common foundation to work with.  If it appears in the game that's a bug.
This is an abstract monster for other turtles to copy from, so that we have some common foundation to work with.  If it appears in the game that's a bug.
This is an abstract monster for other turtle hatchlings to copy from, so that we have some common foundation to work with.  If it appears in the game that's a bug.

description: A timber rattlesnake in its hatchling stage.  It will eventually grow a rattle and learn how to hunt.
The most venomous viper native to New England.  Climatic changes have extended its range far into the north.
//babies: On average, a female rattlesnake gives birth to at least eight babies, up to around fifteen.  Most baby rattlesnakes are born in the early summer, but sometimes in late summer and early autumn.

description: A common species of snake found all across North America.
//: The numbers here can technically go up to 80 snakelets, with averages reaching 40, but lets be honest the game couldn't handle that.

description: A garter snake in its juvenile stage.
A small burrowing reptile that's just enjoying its time hunting earthworms.
//1: The reason its using the lizard faction is that it feeds on worms, so it can't use the snake factions that hunt other small animals.
//2: Actually no info on weight, I just kinda assumed 1g per 1cm of length since they're tiny.

description: A worm snake in its hatchling stage.  Not that much smaller than an adult, actually.
A dark-colored species of freshwater turtle with bright orange markings.
A painted turtle in its hatchling stage.
//: In northmost regions of the range we're looking at 6 years as an absolute minimum to reach adulthood.

description: A prehistoric-looking species of freshwater turtle with a nasty bite.
//: Similar to the garter snake, we're reaching 80 at maximum estimates, but that is a deeply unserious amount of baby turtles for the game to handle.

description: A common snapping turtle in its hatchling stage.
//: 12 years to reach maturity. It should probably be 15 years, because we're reaching the Northern range of the species in the setting, but odds are nobody is ever gonna see those grow to adulthood anyway.

description: A small species of skink.  The only native lizard of New England.
//: This is only a guesstimate. Other species of skinks with similar bodyplan reach ~40g of body mass at over double body length, so what we have is likely higher than in reality.

description: A five-lined skink in its hatchling stage.
//: Sexual maturity at 2-3 years, but there's no way in hell they don't reach adult size before that, so we take 10 months as a fairly safe guesstimate.

description: A mutated timber rattlesnake, about three times as large as the norm.  While it isn't big enough to regard humans as potential prey, it is more aggressive and dangerous compared to a normal rattler.
A large mutated timber rattlesnake in its hatchling stage.  It will eventually grow a rattle and learn how to hunt.

A large mutated timber rattlesnake, about six times as large as the norm.  While it still isn't big enough to regard humans as potential prey, it is much more aggressive and dangerous compared to a normal rattler.

A primal fear strikes when the club-like tail of this massively warped snake shifts, an assortment of bones rattling softly.  Multiple sets of hollow fangs have erupted in its maw, which itself is flanked by skinless ropes of powerful muscle.  Its scales constantly shed off and regrow with unnatural speed.
//grab: Big jaw full of long fangs - about as grabby as you can get without multiple appendages, consider a coiling attack on next update
//grab2: You brought this upon yourself, serpentdom is proud
//babies: Rattlesnake's gestation period is around 90 days, but it varies depending on the breed.  The timber rattlesnake has a gestation period of up to five months.
//babies2: Deathrattle is heavily mutated, so a short gestation period and all-year large clutch birth are plausible

description: An aggressive mutant variety of the worm snake, turned pale yellow from lack of sunlight.  It swarms beneath the ground, and is named for its habit of infesting sewer lines.
The larval form of some species of frog.  This one is only hypothetical and you shouldn't be seeing it without debug.

death_function.message: The %s is smashed to non-recognizable pieces.

description: A speckled, gray-brown tadpole.  Its tail is broad and paddle-like, and its body rotund.  Sometime soon it will grow legs and lose its tail entirely.
Every part of this speckled, green-brown tadpole is thick and broad.  It must be from some larger species of frog.
The larval form of some species of frog.  Soon enough it will undergo metamorphosis into its adult form.  This dark, speckled one has a rather large, bulbous body compared to its thin, tapered tail.
The larval form of some species of frog.  Soon enough it will undergo metamorphosis into its adult form.  This dark, speckled one has a rather large, bulbous body compared to its thin, tapered tail.
A tiny larval frog.  Almost solid black, this one is barely a speck in the water around it.
This rather unique tadpole might be mistaken for a small fish.  It sports a very broad tail with bright red-orange coloration at its end, dotted with black spots.
A brown and tan speckled tadpole with a wide body and very broad, feather-shaped tail.
This yellowish tadpole is covered in flecks of brown and cream coloring.  Its eyes rest close together on a notably pointed face.
A corpulent green tadpole with a yellow underbelly and black speckles.
This mottled brown tadpole appears rather typical until you can get a glimpse from the side.  Then its high, peaked mouth and low round belly stand out in profile.
A squat and wide-bellied tadpole with wide-set eyes.
A tadpole the size of a bass.  It could win awards if it hadn't been debugged.
A giant, gray-brown tadpole.  Its body is covered in irregular, chaotic speckles of pitch black and chalk white.
//: When possible, add effect for rare flicker of very low luminance.

description: This giant, green tadpole would have been an oddity before the collapse.  Now it's simply part of the scenery.
This big tadpole has already grown some warty bumps on its softball-sized body.  Its nearly whip-thin tail appears to have no trouble propelling its much larger core.
Some kind of giant tadpole.  This speckled one has a body the size of a grapefruit and a thin, tapered tail.  It flits about the water in quick bursts.
A much larger than average tadpole.  Despite its unusual size, it is hard to make out any features from its dark, almost black, tint.
This tadpole's expanded size only eccentuates its other unique feature.  Its tail fin is a vibrant gradient of crimson to yellow.
A hypothetical frog, if you're seeing this there's a problem.
Leopard frogs are named for the brown spots on their backs and legs.  Although limited by size, they too are voracious predators.

This large frog is covered in chaotic markings like a fractal river map over a background of TV static.  While most lose their gills during metamorphosis, this frog seems to have retained them, or something like them.
//: When possible, add effect for rare flicker of very low luminance.

description: The American bullfrog, in its natural habitat.  It feeds on insects, mice, lizards, and any other living thing it can stuff down its gullet.
Based on its vestigial tail, you would surmise that this bullfrog still has some growing to do.  That is if it weren't already larger than any adult frog.
Fowler's toads secrete a harmful and distasteful compound from their backs.  This helps safeguard them from predators and also gives them a distinctive odor like boiled peanuts.
You could almost smell it before you saw it.  This toad reeks.  You're not quite sure what like, but it's hot and musky and it sticks in your nose until you're tasting it.
//: NO_BREATHE flag is to prevent gassing by other 'foul' toads.  When possible, add effect for aoe morale debuff around toad. Possibly stack up until triggering nausea/vomiting.

description: American toads can vary greatly in appearance.  Individual toads will shift their coloration and patterning throughout the seasons to better camouflage.
Wide as a watermelon and halfway up to your knee, this toad's size is alarming.  So too are its odd proportions.  It's as if it hasn't fully grown.
This diminutive frog has a distinctive chirping call and bands of darker skin that come to form a rough 'X' shape on its back.

A small brown frog with a very big voice.  When it calls, its whole criss-crossed torso expands and trembles like an inflatable suit.  The loud squeaky sound it makes is more charming than troubling.  The frequency can be exhausting.
This treefrog can change its coloration much like a chameleon, shifting from a near-white gray, through greens and browns, to a dark, almost charcoal color.
You've seen it wrinkle its skin into bark and disappear on a tree; settle on a toadstool and take its spots.  It's no trick of the light, this frog's skin shifts not just color but texture.
This pungent frog is named for the mammal with which it shares both name and odor.  Its skin is light green underneath a heavy spatter of almost black mottling.
This very large, funky frog has an accentuated, paddle-like tail that accounts for half its body mass.  It is green with many brown spots scattering across its back.

The pickerel frog is identifiable by two rows of roughly square-shaped spots that run along its back, shaded a darker brown than the rest of their skin.  Though not more than an irritant to humans, their skin secretions are known for being fatal to most things their size.

You're quite sure that no frog this bright and garish could be native to New England.  Most of its skin is a light brown, but the large, squarish patches on its back and legs are of every different hue, all of them bright.

True to its name this frog is green.  Though this one is certainly of the Northern subspecies, they are common throughout, and native to, the Eastern half of North America.  The shades of green can vary greatly and there might be some brown on the limbs or mottled on the back.
This frog wears a pattern of tans and browns, with a darker eye mask and a light cream underbelly.  Its coverings make for great camouflage among the dry leaves and tree bark.

The eastern variety of the American spadefoot toad is a squat, round toad with vertical pupils.  Its body is colored a muddy mixture of browns, tans, and yellow-greens.  Their name comes from the keratinous projection on their hind legs that aids them in digging.

You see a whole leopard frog and then some.  This poor thing must have almost a dozen extra legs sticking off of it.  It is difficult to determine an exact number as most of them are underdeveloped or otherwise malformed.
A green frog that has suffered some kind of mutation.  At its hips it has clusters of extra legs, some are complete but others lack feet or end at the first joint.
This cream and brown frog looks more like a great insect in profile.  It has evidently mutated, growing many additional, spindly legs that rise high before attempting to bend back downwards.
An unreal frog of unusually large size.  This one is here by mistake; likely drawn by some kind of (de)bug.

special_attacks.hit_dmg_u: %s catches you with its tongue and pulls you in!
special_attacks.hit_dmg_npc: %s catches <npcname> with its tongue and pulls them in!

special_attacks.no_dmg_msg_npc: %s catches <npcname> with its tongue and pulls them in!

description: A mutant bullfrog larger than most dogs.  It looks unwell, as if this growth spurt was less than comfortable.
This toad seems to have been mutated to absurd size by the Cataclysm.  It's only half your size but that hardly feels comforting.

Bioluminescent trails trace through the dark speckled patterns on this oversized frog's skin.  What would be cleanly defined spots on another frog, are instead fragmented collages of gray and black pigment over pale skin.  Its vestigial gills have grown into something else.  You can see them bulging the flesh under its mouth.

This lumpy oversized toad is a real stinker!  A miasma like rotted onions coated in rancid peanut butter surrounds it.  Even approaching it makes your eyes water and your throat tighten until you're coughing to catch breath.  It doesn't help that its leathery skin looks to be coated in a thick greasy substance, no doubt related to the creature's horrid odor.

//: When possible, add an AOE burst & temporary trail of slippery, toxic grease on several hour cooldown.  The toad can expel grease like a squid with ink.  The grease offgasses into something between tear gas and a blister agent, hence the smell.  NO_BREATHE flag is to prevent self-gassing.

description: On, thick over-proportioned legs this large treefrog slings its weight with notable force.  It doesn't seem a danger, but its size is still cause for concern.  Even scrunched up, it is as large as a Thanksgiving turkey.

special_attacks.hit_dmg_u: %s catches you with its tongue and pulls you in!
special_attacks.hit_dmg_npc: %s catches <npcname> with its tongue and pulls them in!

//: Give climbing (Z axis) ability when available.

description: Now the size of a dog, this tan, speckled tree frog will not stop making noise.  Its increased size has only boosted its volume.  It belts out sound in a relentless series of piercing, grinding chirps.

special_attacks.hit_dmg_u: %s catches you with its tongue and pulls you in!
special_attacks.hit_dmg_npc: %s catches <npcname> with its tongue and pulls them in!

special_attacks.no_dmg_msg_npc: %s catches <npcname> with its tongue and pulls them in!

description: You've seen enough to gather that this is a frog with some very specialized camouflage.  Its skin appears able to reactively change texture and color to match its surroundings.  Like a morphing ghillie suit it can extend filaments to mimic individual leaves and blades of grass.  It is keen enough to match the swaying of brush in the wind.
//: Give climbing (Z axis) ability when available.

description.str: This frog is much too big to be real, must be a bug

This pale, trash can-sized frog sports a series of faintly glowing spots among its chaotic skin patterns.  The glow seems most concentrated around its unusually bulky neck and mouth.  Its dark eyes scan for an appetizing target.

Though they seem to be most effective for burrowing and protection, in places they come to curved points that look quite sharp.

The bony growths extend to its face, ringing its eyes and shielding its parotoid glands, swollen with poison.  Though intimidating, it appears more interested in a soothing mud bath than anything violent.

description: This appears to be a very experimental automated tower.  Lacking armor plating and seemingly half-built, it's little more than an oversized laser emitter and a camera, both welded to a swiveling platform.

A white and brown quadcopter drone mounting what looks to be a camera dome and a large antenna array.  It calmly hovers a comfortable distance above the ground, surveiling its surroundings with cold indifference.
An armed and up-armored skitterbot, clad in white plastic plating and mounting a stripped down 7.62 battle rifle over its original cam-arm.

special_attacks.description: The exterminatron legs lock into place as it swings its turret to bear.

//: Duplicate rats created to prevent all rats from evolving into mutant rats, any monster ending in ratkin should only appear in places where mutant rats can evolve.
description: The black rat, an omnivorous rodent with sheer black fur and a long, rough tail.  Harbinger of pestilence, famine, and mange, it will sometimes swarm over the dead or dying.

//: Duplicate rats created to prevent all rats from evolving into mutant rats, any monster ending in ratkin should only appear in places where mutant rats can evolve.
description: The albino Norway rat, an omnivorous rodent with sleek white fur and a long, rough tail.  While its ancestors were harbingers of plague, these clever animals are omnipresent in modern biomedical research.

//: All monsters with faction ratkin should only appear in places that make sense for them to appear.  They are specific to a unique lab and any appearances by them outside of that lab prior to at minimum two seasons after the Cataclysm occurred is nonsensical and should be reported as a bug.
description: This cat-sized rat snuffles along the ground looking for things to eat.  It hisses at anything that comes near it, baring sizable teeth.
This cat sized albino mouse sparks randomly, whenever anything approaches it.
//: All monsters with faction ratkin should only appear in places that make sense for them to appear.  They are specific to a unique lab and any appearances by them outside of that lab prior to at minimum two seasons after the Cataclysm occurred is nonsensical and should be reported as a bug.

description: This albino, humanoid mouse walks on its hind legs.  You can see eddies of wind swirl unnaturally around it as it moves, debris caught in its wake.

//: All monsters with faction ratkin should only appear in places that make sense for them to appear.  They are specific to a unique lab and any appearances by them outside of that lab prior to at minimum two seasons after the Cataclysm occurred is nonsensical and should be reported as a bug.

description: Something is there!  Against all reason, this shadow lurks at the corners of your vision.  You close your eyes, but still, it is there.  No matter how far you run, it is there.  In pitchest black, it is there.  Now you will know why you fear the night.
//6: Slowed and weakened by light of sufficient brightness. (It lurks outside of flashlight range) Luring it into a trap is a viable path to killing it.
//00: Unfortunately, we do need some melee damage so that it can bash through terrain and the like.
//0: Blob bullshit laughs at concepts like armor. This is basically just here as anti-cheese. It should rarely if ever directly attack you.
//1: Try to stay this far away from the player with your regular moves, very important
//2: TODO? Upgrade doesn't actually work because amalgamations do not have evolutions. Ideally this would upgrade them one step *and also remove their timed lifespan*. If this is added/resolved the spell cooldowns probably need to be nerfed.

special_attacks.no_dmg_msg_npc: The shadows recede from <npcname>, and now they stand out like a floodlight!

special_attacks.monster_message: The ground blackens before you.
Your hearing is overwhelmed by a booming sound!

description.str: When even the grass rises against you, what hope do you have?
The fact a shadow can make such an awful, loud sound makes your head want to split in two.
